content.description: A 95 percent confidence interval for the slope of the regression line relating the number of grams of carbohydrates and the number of kilocalories per 100-gram sample of various raw foods is given by <math alttext="2.505 comma 6.696" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>2.505</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mn>6.696</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. The confidence interval is based on a random sample of <math alttext="n" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> raw foods. A check of the conditions for inference on the slope shows they are reasonably met.
content.question: Which of the following is a correct interpretation of the interval?

choices.label: Ninety-five percent of all such samples of size <math alttext="n" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> will produce a sample slope between 2.505 and 6.696 for the regression line relating grams of carbohydrates and kilocalories per 100-gram sample of various raw foods.
The probability is 0.95 that the true slope of the regression line relating grams of carbohydrates and kilocalories per 100-gram sample of various raw foods is between 2.505 and 6.696.

We are 95 percent confident that the slope of the regression line for the random sample of <math alttext="n" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> raw foods is between 2.505 and 6.696.
We are 95 percent confident that the predicted number of kilocalories per 100-gram sample will be between 2.505 and 6.696.
We are 95 percent confident that the true slope of the regression line relating grams of carbohydrates and kilocalories per 100-gram sample of various raw foods is between 2.505 and 6.696.

content.answer: We are 95 percent confident that the true slope of the regression line relating grams of carbohydrates and kilocalories per 100-gram sample of various raw foods is between 2.505 and 6.696.

topic.text: 9.3: Justifying a Claim About the Slope of a Regression Model Based on a Confidence Interval

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Interpret statistical calculations and findings to assign meaning or assess a claim.
